DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to represent disease response in a non-targeted lesion, using RECIST response criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information relating to non-target lesion response.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Other than the one for which something is done.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: Other than the one for which something is done.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Property.changeDescription: Denise Warzel updated Definition by seraching NCI Thesaurus in Admin tool.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: irRECIST: Immune-related Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST)-2013
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/30/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)_The identification of a lesion that is present at baseline, is measurable and is the primary target of the therapeutic intervention._The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:
2023.5.17 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002435. ak 
2023.3.15 Per LS at COG Protocol defined progressive disease (should have been added as a VM Alt Name for PV 3284666). ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)

Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) and/or maintenance of tumor marker levels above the normal limits. (RECIST)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Non-Target Lesion Identification Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com):The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.longName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)
The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: RECISTv1.1:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/23/18 jk chg reg status to Standard for RECIST defined PV list; do not add PVs without checking latest version of guideline.  3/26/18 jk "Not done" and "NE" values added per 2017 iRECIST documentation, Round 5 comments and focus group activities. 8/30/17 tt versioned for changes to PVs per RECIST 1.1, changed max length, added reg status, CSI per Round 5 finalization task.  6/19/16 released. jk 8/20/13 created for RECIST CRF module based on RECISTv1.1 value definitions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Evaluation of Non-Target Lesions Based on RECIST Criteria
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evaluation of Non-Target Lesions Based on RECIST Criteria

DataElement.origin: RECISTv1.1:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1
DataElement.changeDescription: 8/30/17 tt versioned for change to VD, transferred context, changed reg status per Round 5 finalization task.6/19/16 released. jk 11/20/13 changed origin to RECISTv1.1. jc  8/20/13 created for RECIST CRF module; values based on definitions in RECISTv1.1 guideline. jc
